subject: testing database operation
msgSnippet: i am trying to test objects that use the database. in order to leave the database in the same state after the test, one test method has to do a store, load and
messageBody:
i am trying to test objects that use the database. in order to leave the
database in the same state after the test, one test method has to do a
store, load and delete. is this normal? or is there a way to test each
method (store, load, delete) separately, maybe using the setUp() and
tearDown() methods? is there a standard pattern for this?

also the assert methods do not throw anything...do they throw a
RuntimeException or somethnig when they fail? because if i want to do some
clean up in a certain test method using a try-catch-finally block, do i have
to catch a specific runtime exception? or should all cleanup for all methods
be done in the tearDown() method?

thanks
simon
